laboratory_examinations.findings: Peak troponin of 4.5 ng/mL (Patient 1), Peak troponin of 30 ng/mL (Patient 2)

Patient 1: Ejection fraction calculated at 56%, anterior and anteroseptal area of late gadolinium enhancement, T2-weighted imaging shows myocardial edema. Patient 2: Ejection fraction calculated at 45%, two discrete areas of late gadolinium enhancement.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient 1's MRI performed 72 hours after emergent revascularization shows chronic myocardial changes, while Patient 2's MRI indicates acute myocardial edema in the inferior wall.
